column4: Hi. On 1st gen MacBook, soundcard work but not external audio (headphones); there is no possibility to chose the external audio output in the sound settings app. (In Lucid Lynx it was possible). Does anyone know?

are you saying that you cant hear audio coming from your headphones?  Open a terminal and type "alsa-mixer" or "alsamixer" (I forget which) and make sure that you have your mic/headphones/etc enabled and turned up.
That was what I did in Lucid Lynx after having selected the output in the sound settings app. Now it cannnot be selected (there is only the internal option).
In alsamixer, the output seems to be there, but its volume cannot be adjusted.
